column2: Select a subnet id for the Jenkins Server
must be the name of an existing EC2 KeyPair.

{u'Fn::Base64': {u'Fn::Join': [u'', [u'#!/bin/bash -xe
', u'yum update -y aws-cfn-bootstrap
', u'/opt/aws/bin/cfn-init -v ', u' --stack ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::StackName'}, u' --resource JenkinsServer ', u' --configsets install_all ', u' --region ', {u'Ref': u'AWS::Region'}, u'
', u'# Install Jenkins
', u'wget -O /etc/yum.repos.d/jenkins.repo http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins.repo
', u'rpm --import http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/redhat/jenkins-ci.org.key
', u'yum install -y jenkins
', u'service jenkins start
', u'chkconfig jenkins on
', u'# Update the AWS CLI to the latest version
', u'yum update -y aws-cli
', u'# Wait 30 seconds to allow Jenkins to startup
', u'echo "Waiting 30 seconds for Jenkins to start....."
', u'sleep 30
', u'gem install rake
', u'gem install haml
', u'gem install minitest
', u'# Install the required plugins
', u'cd /var/lib/jenkins/plugins
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/multiple-scms.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/github-api.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/scm-api.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/git-client.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/github.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/git.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/codedeploy.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/aws-codepipeline.hpi
', u'curl -O -L https://updates.jenkins-ci.org/latest/rake.hpi
', u'chown jenkins:jenkins *.hpi
', u'# Restarting Jenkins
', u'service jenkins restart
']]}}

[{u'ToPort': u'22', u'IpProtocol': u'tcp', u'CidrIp': {u'Ref': u'YourIPRange'}, u'FromPort': u'22'}, {u'ToPort': u'80', u'IpProtocol': u'tcp', u'CidrIp': {u'Ref': u'YourIPRange'}, u'FromPort': u'80'}]
must be the name of an existing VPC.
[{u'SubnetId': {u'Ref': u'VPCSubnet'}, u'DeviceIndex': u'0', u'GroupSet': [{u'Ref': u'JenkinsSecurityGroup'}], u'AssociatePublicIpAddress': u'true'}]
Enable SSH and HTTP access from specific CIDR block
The VPC Id where the EC2 instances will be launched.
The EC2 Key Pair to allow SSH access to EC2 instances
must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
CIDR block of the network from where you will connect to the Jenkins server using HTTP and SSH
Install Jenkins, nginx and the Jenkins CodeDeploy/CodePipeline plugin
